title: Large-Scale Intensive News English Course for Strengthening International News Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate English reading and listening skills, foundational understanding of scientific phenomena
context.additional_context: Fostering the ability to understand global issues through international news analysis and interpret scientific contexts during a pandemic.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze international news sources across modalities (text/video) with over 80% accuracy
Learners can interpret science-related international news while utilizing over 50 specialized terms

Graduate students can perform three stages (e.g., planning, reporting, editing) of the international news production process (planning-reporting-editing-broadcasting) via role-play simulations within a week, produce a 5-minute news content per team, and achieve ‘excellent’ ratings (80+ points) in two out of three evaluation rubric criteria (topic relevance, information accuracy, delivery effectiveness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
